meanings.definition: Of, relating to, or constituting a serosa.
meanings.sent1: The serosal layer of the tissue was thin and delicate.
meanings.sent2: The doctor noted the serosal fluid surrounding the organ.
meanings.sent3: The serosal wrapping around the gift made it look extra special.
meanings.sent4: Her voice had a serosal quality, smooth and soothing.
meanings.sent5: The serosal sunset painted the sky in shades of pink and gold.

meanings.definition: Of, relating to, or affecting the serous membranes.
meanings.sent1: The serosal inflammation caused discomfort in the patient.
meanings.sent2: The surgeon carefully examined the serosal lining of the abdomen.
meanings.sent3: The serosal rain made the streets glisten like silver.
meanings.sent4: His words had a serosal effect, calming everyone in the room.
meanings.sent5: The serosal touch of the fabric felt cool against her skin.
